qas.question: Where did many of Japan's soldiers come from?
What type of soldiers came from Hong Kong?
What other Asian country, a group of islands, helped the Japanese?
What colonies did Japan conscript soldiers from?
Who were the collaborators assisting Japan in Hong King?

context: Japan conscripted many soldiers from its colonies of <a0_0><a3_0>Korea and Formosa<a3_0/><a0_0/> (Taiwan). To a small extent, some <a4_0>Vichy<a4_0/> French, Indian National Army, and Burmese National Army forces were active in the area of the Pacific War. <a1_0>Collaborationist units<a1_0/> from Hong Kong (reformed <a5_0>ex-colonial police<a5_0/>), <a2_0>Philippines<a2_0/>, Dutch East Indies (the PETA) and Dutch Guinea, British Malaya and British Borneo, Inner Mongolia and former French Indochina (after the overthrow of Vichy French regime) as well as Timorese militia also assisted Japanese war efforts.
